intro: Haplophyllum buxbaumii subsp. mesopotamicum, commonly known as the Mesopotamic starflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Middle East. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, narrow leaves. It is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in arid gardens. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer.
